p.s: Description of Trueperella bernardiae comb. nov.

Trueperella bernardiae (ber.nar′di.ae. N.L. gen. n. bernardiae of Bernard, named after the contemporary Canadian microbiologist Kathryn A. Bernard for her contributions to the study of asporogenous, Gram-positive rods).
Basonym: Actinomyces bernardiae Funke et al. 1995. Arcanobacterium bernardiae (Funke et al. 1995) Ramos et al. 1997 is another homotypic synonym.
The description is the same as given for Arcanobacterium bernardiae by Ramos et al. (1997) with the exception that acid production from glucose is negative.
The species exhibits the characteristics listed in the description of the genus Trueperella.
